clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Cognitive-Communication Deficits Following Treatment of Primary Brain Tumor Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Cognitive-Communication Deficits Following Treatment of Primary Brain Tumor Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to evaluate which cognitive-linguistic symptoms are most commonly experienced following brain tumor treatment. Cognitive surveys will be administered after treatment of primary brain tumor cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Survey is completed at time of consent

secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 3 months of cognitive communication survey
within 6 months after completion of standardized testing

intervention.description: Complete the Cognitive Communication Survey, standardized cognitive and language assessments, and the Follow-up Cognitive Communication Survey after treatment

study_pop.textblock: adults diagnosed with a malignant brain tumor either as a primary diagnosis or recurrent
